rationale: The agent modified the wrong section of the documentation. The task was to 'fix the confusing wording in the cluster health timeout documentation,' and the ground truth clarified the example paragraph (lines 38-43) that explains how the timeout works when waiting for cluster status. The agent instead modified the parameter reference section (lines 75-78), changing 'wait_for_XXX' to explicitly list parameter names. While this is a minor improvement to that section, it completely misses the actual confusing wording identified in the ground truth. The agent's change addresses a different clarity issue in a different part of the document, failing to implement the requested fix.
ground_truth_patch:
diff --git a/docs/reference/cluster/health.asciidoc b/docs/reference/cluster/health.asciidoc
index 52685de9f480..48108e145be1 100644
--- a/docs/reference/cluster/health.asciidoc
+++ b/docs/reference/cluster/health.asciidoc
@@ -38,9 +38,9 @@ status is controlled by the worst index status.
 
 One of the main benefits of the API is the ability to wait until the
 cluster reaches a certain high water-mark health level. For example, the
-following will wait till the cluster reaches the `yellow` level for 50
-seconds (if it reaches the `green` or `yellow` status beforehand, it
-will return):
+following will wait for 50 seconds for the cluster to reach the `yellow`
+level (if it reaches the `green` or `yellow` status before 50 seconds elapse,
+it will return at that point):
 
 [source,js]
 --------------------------------------------------
